question:
Given the following [DIALOGUE] with a masked ([__]) word and its English [MEANING], which word (IPA) from languages other than English sounds most fitting in context based on auditory impression?

[MEANING]
A word that describes both a way of playing the koto and the resulting tone. It refers to plucking the three strings in succession from the highest to the lowest note, with the next lower string being plucked together with the string that forms an octave or unison with it. As this distinctive sound appears very frequently in koto music, the word is also used to refer to koto music itself.

[DIALOGUE]
Misaki: Yesterday, I watched a live koto performance at the art museum. It was so beautiful, I couldn't take my eyes off it.
